page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY DARTMOOR
page.content: The Buckland area has archaeological remains spanning 4,000 years.The earliest remains are situated on open moorland on Horridge Common.There is a well defined parallel reave system(low earth bank) which denotes arable farming being done in the 2nd.millenium B.C.Within this system are small hut circles and the cairns on Rippon Tor are of the same period.A few yards South across a solid track built this century to remove timber for pit-props from { {Bagtor Woods,}is a later{Iron Age} settlement comprising large hut circles and a complex of small fields. In the South-West sector is {Holne Chase Castle}now thickly wooded.This is an{Iron Age Hill Fort } where iron currency bars of the 1st.millenium B.C.have been found.
